description: Dive into "Capturing Da Nang: Snapshots of Beauty" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Da Nang: Snapshots of Beauty

places.generalDescription: When exploring Da Nang, Vietnam, a visit to Asia Park is an experience that shouldn't be overlooked. This modern amusement park boasts a stunning Ferris wheel that offers breathtaking views of the city skyline, especially enchanting at night. While it may not be the largest theme park in Southeast Asia, its charm lies in its unique themed areas inspired by various Asian countries and thrilling rides. Visitors often find themselves pleasantly surprised by the fun atmosphere and friendly staff.

sources.shortName: Things To Do In Da Nang

places.name: Da Nang DownTown

reviews.text: Great theme park! Went on a Monday afternoon which was pretty quiet..no long queues and lots of space to walk around and take photos. Great food and drink stalls around to keep you going all evening. Toilets are super clean and fresh too!

Pretty decent park ‚Äì especially if you're not a fan of crowds.
There were literally no lines at all ‚Äì it felt like we had the whole park to ourselves. On every ride, it was either just a couple of other people or no one else at all. Most of the attractions were closed, but honestly, we went there mainly for one thing ‚Äì The Queen Cobra. And it didn't disappoint ‚Äì super thrilling, a bit scary in a good way, and definitely worth it.

There are more rides available for kids, and I think they'd enjoy the park more overall. If you're planning to go on the Ferris wheel, do it after sunset or around golden hour ‚Äì the city views are way better with the lights on or with the sun going down.

The park itself is really beautiful, clean, and well-designed ‚Äì definitely some cool spots to take photos or just walk around. But don't expect to spend a whole day there ‚Äì 2 to 4 hours tops is more than enough, especially since a lot of stuff isn't operating.

Important tip: bring cash. None of the food or shops inside the park accept cards, which was a bit inconvenient.

All in all, it's a nice park, more suited for families with kids, but I'd still recommend getting the ticket with rides ‚Äì even if it's just for the Queen Cobra. Totally worth it for that one ride alone.

Fantastic little find, so bright and colourful. My little boy (7) had a blast. You are not allowed to take water or food in but it is not expensive in the park. Bottled water and fizzy pop is around 20k VND, snacks are sold around the park too which are equally inexpensive. We paid for the unlimited tickets at 250k VND for each adult and 125k VND for kiddo - which in comparison to UK theme parks is really cheap. I'm not convinced we kicked the butt out of the 'unlimited' rides but we certainly had a good time. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Da Nang, Con Market is a vibrant and historic marketplace that has been captivating visitors since 1940. This sprawling hub spans an impressive 14,000 square meters and features thousands of vendors offering everything from fresh produce to unique clothing and household items.

sources.snippet: Con Market is one of the primary markets in Da Nang City, popular for its astounding range of clothing, accessories, and handicrafts available at affordable rates. Known alternatively as Da Nang Commercial Centre, it is the biggest and busiest retail and wholesale venue in and around the city. It is noted for an array of wholesale goods available at heavily discounted prices.
sources.shortName: 48 Best Things to do in Da Nang Vietnam 2025
Things To Do In Da Nang

places.name: Con Market

reviews.text: Con Market is a vibrant explosion of local culture! The endless stalls are packed with souvenirs, quirky tees, and handmade bags-so much to see (but so hard to choose the perfect tee with all the crowds!). The energy here is electric, with tiny restaurants tucked in every corner serving up delicious street food. It's chaotic in the best way, though definitely not for the claustrophobic! A must-visit for authentic Da Nang vibes-just come early to beat the rush!

The market can be quite pack at certain time especially on weekend. If you go early like 10am, the place probably has much less people and you can enjoy the shopping experience. I went there mainly for food and drink. Fried banana is delicious only for 10k. Kem Bo and smoothie are nice too

A Treasure Trove of Local Delights
- Friendly vendors and a lively atmosphere: This bustling marketplace is perfect for exploring local specialties.
- Variety of local food options: Savor delicious banh mi, paper roll pork, dumplings, and refreshing avocado drinks.
- Fresh produce and dried goods: Discover an array of fresh fruits, nuts, and dried goods to take home.
- Unique souvenirs and homeware: Browse an assortment of local handicrafts, souvenirs, and homeware items.

Highlights and Tips
- More to offer than Han Market: This marketplace provides a more diverse and interesting shopping experience.
- Walkable distance from Han Market: Easily accessible on foot, but be aware of the ongoing pavement renovation.
- Be prepared for a lively atmosphere: With many vendors and shoppers, this marketplace can be quite lively and energetic.

Recommendations
- Arrive early to beat the crowds: Get there early to explore the market before it gets busy.
- Try local specialties: Don't miss the opportunity to try some of the unique local foods and drinks.
- Haggle politely: Be prepared to haggle prices, but do so in a respectful and friendly manner.

places.address: 90 H√πng V∆∞∆°ng, H·∫£i Ch√¢u, ƒê√† N·∫µng 550000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Dragon Bridge in Da Nang is a must-visit destination, offering a glamorous view of the city and showcasing four famous bridges: Thuan Phuoc Bridge, Han River Bridge, Dragon Bridge, and Tran Thi Ly Bridge. The 666-meter long bridge features a unique design with a mighty yellow dragon that breathes fire and water on weekends. Visitors can also enjoy special programs such as New Year's Eve art celebrations and traditional Vietnamese music performances at Dragon Bridge East Park.

sources.snippet: Dragon Bridge is the largest one in Vietnam and lies over the Han River. This modern bridge is quite the sight, especially on Saturdays and Sundays at 9:00 PM when it's lit up, emitting fire and water displays from the eponymous Dragon's Mouth. There are also pretty cafes lining the bridge from where you can marvel at this majestic display.
sources.shortName: 48 Best Things to do in Da Nang Vietnam 2025

sources.snippet: Dragon Bridge is the most iconic landmark in Da Nang City finely constructed in the shape of a dragon lying across the Han River. It offers a dazzling display of lights, fire, and water that no first-time visitor to Da Nang should miss out on. Dragon Bridge could be seen from many spots in Da Nang city.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Photo Spots of Dragon Bridge, Vietnam

sources.snippet: Dragon Bridge is considered as one of the symbols of the city and famous tourist attraction in Da Nang. Dragon Bridge is the most famous bridge, spanning the Han River and connecting Nguyen Van Linh and Vo Van Kiet streets. The bridge is shaped like a dragon flying over the river facing the East Sea.
sources.shortName: Da Nang Tourist Attractions ‚Äì Places to visit in Da Nang

sources.snippet: As one of the places to visit in Danang Vietnam, Dragon Bridge is the special one that make many tourists curious. Dragon Bridge is in the center of the city and very close to the airport, the train station and leading to the sea. That is why it is very easy to see this bridge when you reach Da Nang.
sources.shortName: Top 11 places to visit in DaNang Vietnam you CANNOT miss

sources.snippet: Dragon Bridge has already made a mark and become an iconic symbol of Da Nang. The bridge is shaped like a dragon flying over the Han River, facing the sea, which is very unique. It is also the shortest route from Da Nang International Airport to the main roads in the city.
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Photo Spots in Da Nang for Social Media Enthusiasts

sources.snippet: Beautiful suspension bridges may be seen in many Vietnamese cities. However, Da Nang boasts the longest of these bridges, the Dragon Bridge. The residents are understandably proud of the dragon structure on this state-of-the-art, six-lane bridge.
sources.shortName: The 12 Best Places to Visit in Da Nang You Cannot Miss

sources.snippet: Watch this modern architectural wonder and breathe fire and water every weekend night. A river tour is a great way to see the dragon bridge in action.
sources.shortName: Things To Do In Da Nang

places.name: Dragon Bridge

reviews.text:
This was one of the most unique and exciting experiences I had in Vietnam! The Dragon Bridge itself is already impressive by day, but at 9:00 PM on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, it truly comes alive.

The show started right on time and lasted about 10‚Äì15 minutes. First, the dragon breathed fire-giant bursts that lit up the night sky. Then came the water spray, which was just as fun (though be warned: if you're standing close, you will get wet!).

Am also visit Son tra night market which is walkable

It was a great show that could have been even better with music and lights synchronized to the performance. We attended on a Sunday and discovered that standing on the road beneath the bridge provides a much better view, as standing too close doesn't give you the full perception of the dragon breathing fire.

The show lasted for 15 minutes, during which the dragon breathes fire and sprays water. Be prepared to get wet if you stand close, or stay further back if you want to remain dry.

- The entire road gets blocked during the show
- You might not be able to get Grab taxis immediately after
- It's better to walk about 1 km away from the bridge to book cabs for better availability
- The distance also gives you a better overall view of the spectacle

Overall, it's an impressive display worth seeing, just plan your transportation accordingly!

I absolutely love Dragon Bridge. I had such a beautiful time there today with my aunties and uncle. It was one of those simple yet unforgettable moments. The view is stunning, especially when the dragon lights up in the evening. The whole area feels alive and full of energy, but there's also a calmness when you're just walking along the river and soaking it all in.

I also really loved the nearby Love Bridge. It's such a sweet and romantic spot, perfect for taking photos or just enjoying the peaceful view of the water and city lights.

Dragon Bridge isn't just a tourist spot. It's a special place where memories are made. üíõ I'd definitely come back again.

places.address: C·∫ßu R·ªìng, An H·∫£i, S∆°n Tr√†, ƒê√† N·∫µng 550000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: The Danang Fine Arts Museum is a modern space that houses an impressive collection of paintings, sculptures, ceramics, and more. It is the third largest art museum in Vietnam and features a three-story building with diverse exhibitions. The first floor showcases native modern and alternative art, while the second floor preserves oil paintings, sculptures, lacquered paintings, and war arts. The third floor offers an assorted collection of traditional, ancient, and applied arts.

sources.snippet: After Vietnam Museum of Arts in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang Fine Arts Museum is the third largest art museum in Vietnam. This museum is a three-storey building where the first floor is dedicated to the native modern and alternative art exhibition. The second floor preserves oil paintings, sculptures, lacquered paintings, war arts and the third floor houses an assorted collection of multip (Read More)le art forms like traditional, ancient, and applied arts.
sources.shortName: 48 Best Things to do in Da Nang Vietnam 2025

places.name: Danang Fine Arts Museum

reviews.text:
Looking for a quiet and artsy spot in Da Nang? The Da Nang Fine Arts Museum is a great choice. It's located in a beautiful French colonial building and the atmosphere is very peaceful and pleasant.

Here, you can admire over 1,000 artworks, including paintings, sculptures, and lacquer work. It's a great opportunity to learn more about Vietnamese art through pieces inspired by local life and traditions.

Very nice exhibition of Vietnamese art and artists. The 1st floor was closed to remodeling so only the upper 2 exhibit floors were open. The artwork was very good and you could see the traditional arts as well as those influenced by impressionist and other art movements of the late 19th century. It was enjoyable.

Probably my favorite museum in Vietnam. The artwork is so beautiful and extensive from watercolor to sculpture work and my personal favorite lacquer. Was very impressed with the collections. The lighting isn't the best for taking photos of the works but art is better experienced in person anyway so do yourself a favor and stop by.

places.address: 78 ƒê. L√™ Du·∫©n, Th·∫°ch Thang, H·∫£i Ch√¢u, ƒê√† N·∫µng 550000, Vietnam

sources.snippet: A 200 ton - weight, 7.5 meter high Dragon Carp is standing on the east bank of the Han River in Da Nang, attracting thousands of visitors each day to visit, admire and take photograph. The image of Dragon carp has not only aesthetic sense, but also become a symbol of art and beliefs about the carp overcome all difficulties, turn into dragon. The Dragon Carp Statue may look a little drab during the day, but once the sun sets, the place is transformed into a beautifully illuminated display of lights.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Photo Spots of Dragon Bridge, Vietnam

places.name: T∆∞·ª£ng C√° Ch√©p H√≥a R·ªìng

reviews.text:
I'd recommend to visit at night as the fountain is right next to the ‚ÄòLove's Pier' which glows red at night and the fountain does too and it overall just looks visually nice. To the right of the fountain are stores which you can buy toys, souvenirs, and heart shaped lockets for the ‚ÄòLove's Pier'.

The fountain is just a 5 minute or less walk from the Dragon Bridge, near restaurants, cafes, and such. It looks similar to the Merlion in Singapore as well but still looks different enough to distinguish. Overall, a nice place to visit but not a super must to visit I'd say.

I came to Vietnam for a three-week vacation. My cousin recommended that I visit the Dragon Carp Fountain in ƒê√† N·∫µng, Vietnam. We went there for a walk and took some pictures for memories. The Dragon Bridge looked alright. I believe it looks more beautiful at night than during the daytime. We walked around the Dragon Bridge area to take some photographs.

Located right next to Dragon Bridge along the Han River, this beautiful Dragon Carp Fountain reminded me a lot of the fountains in Kampot and Singapore. It's one of those landmarks that draws the camera out - day or night.

At night it lights up in shifting colours and makes for a great photo op, just be careful if you're trying to pose under the water stream - you will get wet! It's a popular stop for locals and visitors alike, and a fun little spot to relax by the river.

places.address: ƒê. Tr·∫ßn H∆∞ng ƒê·∫°o, An H·∫£i, S∆°n Tr√†, ƒê√† N·∫µng 550000, Vietnam

places.generalDescription: Han River Bridge is a modern structure that can swing aside to make way for passing ships and is beautifully illuminated at night. It's one of the four main bridges in Da Nang and a popular attraction for visitors. Walking along this bridge offers a stunning view of the city, including other famous bridges like Thuan Phuoc Bridge, Dragon Bridge, and Tran Thi Ly Bridge.

sources.snippet: Han River Bridge is the first modern bridge in Da Nang and it is the first cable-stayed swing bridge in Vietnam. It not only facilitates transport but also has been the symbol of this gorgeous seaside city for years. This bridge is another great spot that you can take a stroll and enjoy capturing Dragon Bridge, especially if you want to get a decent picture of it all, about mid - way between the two bridges is the best spot.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Photo Spots of Dragon Bridge, Vietnam

sources.snippet: The bridge was built by the contribution of all entire Da Nang people, so the Han River Bridge is not only a connection in transportation but also a pride of the people of Da Nang. Every day, the bridge rotates 90 degrees around the axis at 0:30, opening the way for large ships to pass by, and close at 3:30. You can enjoy watching the bridge as it lights up brightly at night.
sources.shortName: Da Nang Tourist Attractions ‚Äì Places to visit in Da Nang

sources.snippet: When mentioning Da Nang, it‚Äôs almost impossible to miss the poetic Han River and Han River Bridge ‚Äì the first rotating bridge in Vietnam, and a source of pride for Da Nang residents in the early 2000s. The unique bridge has a middle section that can be split in half and rotated 90 degrees along the flow of the river to create a large channel for port ships to pass through.
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Photo Spots in Da Nang for Social Media Enthusiasts

sources.snippet: Han River Bridge is one of the prime examples of ingenious engineering!. It is the first swing bridge in Vietnam and stretches over the Han River for 487 meters. Travel to the bridge at around 11 PM on a weekend when the traffic is stopped and the bridge swings on its axis for about 15 to 20 minutes to allow the shipping traffic in the Han River to pass through.
sources.shortName: 48 Best Things to do in Da Nang Vietnam 2025

sources.snippet: Han River Bridge is a must-go destination when in Da Nang, also one of the oldest bridges and becomes a symbol of this city. For a long time ago, Han River Bridge was made to sway in the mid-night for all the boats going through for trading. At that time, they did not know that the swaying thing now make this bridge the most special one in the country.
sources.shortName: Top 11 places to visit in DaNang Vietnam you CANNOT miss

sources.snippet: The Han River Bridge was built for two years, from 1998 to 2000. Vietnamese architects and construction workers did take great pride in this bridge. Its aesthetic value lies in its potential to improve transit, increase local tourism, and stimulate economic development in Da Nang.
sources.shortName: The 12 Best Places to Visit in Da Nang You Cannot Miss

places.name: Han River Bridge

reviews.text:
Han River Bridge, Da Nang ‚Äì A Mesmerizing Nighttime Marvel

As the sun sets and Da Nang's skyline begins to glow, the Han River Bridge transforms into a stunning spectacle of light and movement, capturing the soul of this modern coastal city. Known as Vietnam's first swing bridge, it spans the Han River in the heart of Da Nang, serving both as a functional passage and a symbolic icon of the city's growth and innovation.

At night, the bridge comes alive in brilliant colors. LED lighting systems illuminate the structure in shifting hues-blues, purples, golds, and reds-that reflect beautifully on the water below. These glowing reflections ripple with the movement of the river, creating a scene that's both peaceful and dynamic. The constant color transitions add a layer of visual drama, making it a favorite spot for photographers, couples, and nighttime strollers.

One of the most magical experiences is witnessing the bridge swing open, which typically occurs around midnight on weekends and public holidays. The central span slowly rotates on its axis to allow large vessels to pass-a rare and captivating event that attracts both locals and tourists alike.

Surrounding the bridge, Da Nang's riverside promenade is equally enchanting. Buildings, hotels, and nearby attractions like the Dragon Bridge and Tran Thi Ly Bridge are also lit up, creating a continuous chain of lights along the riverbanks. Streetlights, caf√©s, and rooftop bars add to the vibrancy, offering plenty of places to sit, sip, and soak in the view.

The Han River Bridge at night reflects Da Nang's unique blend of technology, culture, and natural beauty. It's not just a way to cross the river-it's a celebration of modern Vietnam under a starlit sky.

I was pretty skeptical about booking after the slightly strange claims from the owner, and Google maps saying it's a bridge (?), but this was one of the best meals we have had in Vietnam. The food was outstanding and beautifully presented, the scenery is amazing and atmospheric. Worth the price, which isn't that bad at all. 1.5m dong for 5 people mains and desserts, and drinks.

You know, when you're in Da Nang, you really should check out the Han River Bridge! It's the only swing bridge in Vietnam and is a huge symbol for the city. It's not just a tourist spot-it's a really important part of daily life for the locals, too. Its unique design has really helped put Da Nang on the global travel map.

The best part? The middle of the bridge actually swings open at 11:00 PM on weekends and holidays. It's a cool sight that a lot of tourists love to watch!

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Da Nang, Ch√πa Ph√°p L√¢m is a vibrant temple that beautifully showcases intricate craftsmanship and stunning architecture. This two-storey pagoda, located along Ong Ich Khiem Street, is surrounded by lush greenery and meticulously maintained gardens, creating an oasis of tranquility amidst the city's hustle and bustle. Visitors are often captivated by the serene atmosphere where locals engage in morning prayers alongside monks going about their daily routines. The courtyard features impressive statues, including a magnificent 1.

sources.snippet: Despite being in the middle of a busy city, the Phap Lam Pagoda exudes an air of peacefulness and serenity that many people are looking for. In addition to its spiritual significance, this location is stunning since there are many trees, exquisite Buddhist statues, and well-kept gardens. Seeing the locals and monks gather every morning to pray is a moving sight, giving a closer zoom into local culture and religion.
sources.shortName: The 12 Best Places to Visit in Da Nang You Cannot Miss
Things To Do In Da Nang

places.name: Ch√πa Ph√°p L√¢m

reviews.text: If you want to get to know the culture and religion of Vietnam better, you must visit, you must take off your shoes when entering, you must wear snocks, the floor is cold in December and if you are lucky you will meet a very kind aunt who works in the pagoda and she will give you sweets

Beautiful pagoda, free entry, very difficult to find on Google map and nothing great to see inside.
When I visited it was partially closed and nobody was inside the temple.
Very calm nice temple
